en: Newspapers did not report the news.
zh: 报纸没有报道这则新闻。

en: Newspapers did not report that news.
zh: 报纸没有报道那则新闻。

en: Have you got through with the paper?
zh: 你的论文写完了吗？

en: How many papers do you take?
zh: 你订阅多少份报纸？

en: The newspaper is by your side.
zh: 报纸就在你旁边。

en: The newspaper reported friction between the two parties.
zh: 报纸报道了两党之间的摩擦。

en: The function of the press is to provide the common people with facts.
zh: 新闻媒体的职能是向大众提供事实。

en: It is from advertising that a newspaper earns most of its profits.
zh: 报纸的大部分利润来自广告。

en: Reject all its lies and vulgarity.
zh: 拒绝它的一切谎言和庸俗。

en: Don't go by what the newspapers say.
zh: 不要相信报纸上说的话。

en: What is reported in the paper is an obvious fact.
zh: 报纸上报道的是一个显而易见的事实。

en: A criticism of literary works this year is in the paper.
zh: 今年有一篇关于文学作品的评论发表在报纸上。

en: According to the paper, there was an earthquake in Mexico.
zh: 根据报纸报道，墨西哥发生了地震。

en: According to the paper, it will snow tomorrow.
zh: 根据报纸报道，明天会下雪。

en: I think I will advertise in the paper.
zh: 我想在报纸上登广告。

en: According to the paper, there was an earthquake in Peru.
zh: 根据报纸报道，秘鲁发生了地震。

en: According to the newspapers, he will be here today.
zh: 根据报纸报道，他今天会来这里。

en: According to the newspaper, he participated in the plot.
zh: 根据报纸报道，他参与了阴谋。

en: According to the newspaper, the cost of living in Tokyo is the highest in the world.
zh: 根据报纸报道，东京的生活成本是世界上最高的。

en: According to the newspaper, the boy was knocked unconscious and lay on his back with his eyes closed.
zh: 根据报纸报道，那个男孩被打昏了，仰面躺着，闭着眼睛。

en: The newspaper reports the prime minister has died of cancer.
zh: 报纸报道首相死于癌症。

en: According to the paper, there was an earthquake last night.
zh: 根据报纸报道，昨晚发生了地震。

en: According to the papers, there was a big fire in the town.
zh: 根据报纸报道，镇上发生了一场大火。

en: The papers say that there was a big fire in Nagoya.
zh: 报纸说名古屋发生了一场大火。

en: According to the newspaper, he will be here today.
zh: 根据报纸报道，他今天会来这里。

en: The newspaper says that he committed suicide.
zh: 报纸上说他自杀了。

en: According to the newspaper, he committed suicide.
zh: 根据报纸报道，他自杀了。

en: According to the papers, the man has finally confessed.
zh: 根据报纸报道，那个人终于认罪了。

en: The newspaper said that a typhoon was approaching.
zh: 报纸上说台风正在逼近。

en: The paper says that a typhoon is on its way.
zh: 报纸上说台风就要来了。

en: According to the newspaper, there was a big fire last night.
zh: 根据报纸报道，昨晚发生了一场大火。

en: The newspaper said that XYZ oil company went belly-up today.
zh: 报纸上说XYZ石油公司今天倒闭了。

en: According to the paper, there was a big fire in Boston.
zh: 根据报纸报道，波士顿发生了一场大火。

en: Newspapers carry weather reports.
zh: 报纸刊登天气预报。

en: There's nothing important in the paper.
zh: 报纸上没什么重要的内容。

en: There is nothing interesting in the newspaper.
zh: 报纸上没什么有趣的内容。

en: There was nothing interesting in the newspaper.
zh: 报纸上没什么有趣的内容。

en: Not a day seems to pass without newspapers reporting the war.
zh: 几乎每天报纸都在报道战争。

en: Where's the newspaper?
zh: 报纸在哪儿？

en: Where is the newspaper?
zh: 报纸在哪里？

en: I saw in the paper that he had returned from the South Pole.
zh: 我在报纸上看到他从南极回来了。

en: What the newspaper said about the weather has certainly come true.
zh: 报纸上说的天气预报果然应验了。

en: What the newspaper said about the weather will certainly come true.
zh: 报纸上说的天气预报肯定会应验的。

en: What the newspapers say is true.
zh: 报纸上说的都是真的。

en: I clipped some articles out of the newspaper.
zh: 我从报纸上剪下了一些文章。

en: Let me read the newspaper if you've finished with it.
zh: 你看完报纸后让我看看。

en: Two whole pages of the newspaper were devoted to the news of the royal divorce.
zh: 报纸有整整两版都在报道皇室离婚的消息。

en: Newspapers, television, and radio are called the mass media.
zh: 报纸、电视和广播被称为大众传媒。

en: The new discovery proved useful to science.
zh: 这项新发现证明对科学很有用。

en: We had a very good time at a New Year's party.
zh: 我们在新年晚会上玩得很开心。

en: How do you spend the New Year?
zh: 你新年是怎么过的？

en: May the new year bring you happiness!
zh: 祝你新年快乐！

en: New Year is the time for a lot of eating and drinking.
zh: 新年是吃吃喝喝的好时候。

en: The New Year came in with a light fall of snow.
zh: 新年伴着一场小雪到来了。

en: The New Year was drawing near.
zh: 新年临近了。

en: Happy New Year, Louise!
zh: 路易丝，新年快乐！

en: A new broom sweeps clean.
zh: 新官上任三把火。

en: Mr Suzuki, our new teacher, teaches us English.
zh: 铃木老师，我们的新老师，教我们英语。

en: The new ambassador will push for a cease-fire to stop the killing.
zh: 新大使将推动停火以制止杀戮。

en: The new teacher is fresh from college.
zh: 新老师刚从大学毕业。

en: What's the new teacher like?
zh: 新老师怎么样？

en: The new teacher was a disappointment to the class.
zh: 新老师让全班同学都很失望。

en: A new teacher's going to take charge of this class.
zh: 一位新老师将负责这个班级。

en: You will be interested to know that we have just introduced our new Managing Director, Mr Masaru Ezaki.
zh: 您一定会感兴趣知道我们刚刚介绍了我们的新任总经理，江崎胜先生。

en: Acquaint a newcomer with the rules of the club.
zh: 让新来的人熟悉俱乐部的规则。

en: We will have a period of orientation for freshmen.
zh: 我们将为新生安排一段时间的入学指导。

en: Did you enjoy yourself at the welcoming party for freshmen?
zh: 你喜欢参加为新生举办的迎新会吗？

en: Don't make fun of the new student!
zh: 不要取笑新同学！

en: The new students entered the hall full of hope.
zh: 新生们满怀希望地进入大厅。

en: The new boys soon accustomed themselves to the school.
zh: 新来的男生很快就适应了学校的生活。

en: A new student came into the class.
zh: 一个新学生走进了教室。

en: The new employee glossed over his first mistake.
zh: 新员工掩盖了他第一次犯的错误。

en: It will be your job to acquaint the newcomer with the rules of the office.
zh: 你的工作是让新来的人熟悉办公室的规章制度。

en: You're new, huh?
zh: 你是新来的，是吗？

en: What do you think of the new Cabinet?
zh: 你觉得新内阁怎么样？

en: The New Tokyo International Airport was opened in Narita.
zh: 新的东京国际机场在成田开放了。

en: From the Tokyo International Airport to Tokyo, you can take a train or an airport shuttle bus.
zh: 从东京国际机场到东京，你可以乘坐火车或机场巴士。

en: I doubt the new proposal will be accepted.
zh: 我怀疑新的提案是否会被接受。

en: The new president wants to build up the army.
zh: 新总统想要扩充军队。

en: The new minister took over the job on Monday.
zh: 新部长星期一上任了。

en: The new Diet member was smoking, leaning back proudly in a chair.
zh: 那位新当选的国会议员抽着烟，骄傲地靠在椅子上。

en: Fresh vegetables promote health.
zh: 新鲜蔬菜有益健康。

en: I opened the window so I might let fresh air in.
zh: 我打开窗户，好让新鲜空气进来。

en: Let in some fresh air.
zh: 让一些新鲜空气进来。

en: Please let in some fresh air.
zh: 请让一些新鲜空气进来。

en: Let's breathe the fresh air.
zh: 让我们呼吸新鲜空气。

en: What with fresh air and proper exercise, he recovered from his illness quickly.
zh: 由于新鲜空气和适当的锻炼，他很快就从疾病中恢复了。

en: There is nothing like fresh air.
zh: 没有什么比新鲜空气更好的了。

en: Fresh air and exercise are good for the health.
zh: 新鲜空气和锻炼对健康有益。

en: Fresh air is blowing in.
zh: 新鲜空气吹进来了。

en: I feel like getting some fresh air.
zh: 我想出去呼吸一些新鲜空气。

en: I want to breathe some fresh air.
zh: 我想呼吸一些新鲜空气。

en: I want to eat fresh fish.
zh: 我想吃新鲜的鱼。

en: Fresh fruit and vegetables are good for your health.
zh: 新鲜水果和蔬菜对你的健康有益。

en: Fresh fruit is good for the health.
zh: 新鲜水果对健康有益。

en: Fresh fruit is good for your health.
zh: 新鲜水果对健康有益。

en: Fresh fruit is good for you.
zh: 新鲜水果对你有好处。

en: I have a craving for fresh fruit.
zh: 我渴望吃新鲜水果。

en: The sight of fresh lobster gave me an appetite.
zh: 看到新鲜的龙虾，我有了食欲。

en: It is great fun skiing on new-fallen snow.
zh: 在新下的雪上滑雪非常有趣。

en: It's a lot of fun skiing in fresh snow.
zh: 在新鲜的雪地里滑雪非常有趣。

en: Skiing in fresh snow is a lot of fun.
zh: 在新鲜的雪地里滑雪非常有趣。

en: The fresh snow looks beautiful on the hill.
zh: 山上的新雪看起来很漂亮。

en: The site for the new school has been bought.
zh: 新学校的用地已经买好了。

en: In asking voters to approve the new tax, the President appealed to reason.
zh: 在要求选民批准新税时，总统诉诸理性。

en: My uncle's company launched a new product last month.
zh: 我叔叔的公司上个月推出了一款新产品。

en: The company plans to sell the new product for $1,000.
zh: 该公司计划以1000美元的价格出售这款新产品。

en: Many questions came up about the quality of the new product.
zh: 关于新产品的质量，出现了很多问题。

en: Excitement over the new product spread quickly throughout the division.
zh: 对新产品的兴奋迅速在整个部门蔓延开来。

en: I was disappointed with the new product.
zh: 我对这款新产品感到失望。

en: You will soon accustom yourself to the new life.
zh: 你很快就会适应新的生活。

en: The new government is expected to bring about a good number of administrative reforms.
zh: 新政府预计将带来相当数量的行政改革。

en: The new system proved a success.
zh: 新系统被证明是成功的。

en: It's a whole new ball of wax.
zh: 这完全是另一回事。

en: A new actor was billed to appear as Hamlet.
zh: 一位新演员被安排出演哈姆雷特。

en: The newcomer fell short of our expectation.
zh: 这位新人没有达到我们的期望。

en: With the appearance of a promising new writer, the aging novelist fell from prominence.
zh: 随着一位有前途的新作家的出现，这位年迈的小说家失去了声望。

en: The new boxer outboxed the champion.
zh: 这位新拳击手击败了冠军。

en: Where do I have to transfer to get to Shinjuku?
zh: 我需要在哪里换乘才能到达新宿？

en: There are many department stores and supermarkets in Shinjuku.
zh: 新宿有很多百货商店和超市。

en: Will you tell me how to get to Shinjuku?
zh: 你能告诉我怎么去新宿吗？

en: You have to change trains at Shinjuku.
zh: 你必须在新宿换乘火车。

en: Change trains at Shinjuku.
zh: 在新宿换乘火车。

en: Some new kinds of rice can be harvested two or three times a year.
zh: 一些新的水稻品种一年可以收获两到三次。

en: Can we afford a new car?
zh: 我们能负担得起一辆新车吗？

en: I'm going to buy a new car.
zh: 我打算买一辆新车。

en: The new car underwent its tests successfully.
zh: 这辆新车成功通过了测试。

en: I can't afford a new car, so I'll have to make this one do.
zh: 我买不起新车，所以只能将就这辆了。

en: The new president can be relied upon, can't he?
zh: 这位新总统是可以信赖的，不是吗？

en: The new boss has whipped the company into shape.
zh: 新老板已经把公司整顿得井井有条。

en: The newcomers will have to compete with each other for a promotion.
zh: 新来的人为了升职必须相互竞争。

en: The new fact has come to light.
zh: 这个新事实已经真相大白。

en: The new business was eating away his fortune.
zh: 这项新生意正在逐渐耗尽他的财产。

en: His new movie earned him an Academy Award.
zh: 他的新电影为他赢得了一座奥斯卡奖。

en: The honeymoon will be spent abroad.
zh: 蜜月将在国外度过。

en: For their honeymoon they took a voyage around the world.
zh: 为了他们的蜜月旅行，他们进行了一次环球航行。

en: The new international airport really put Narita on the map.
zh: 新的国际机场确实让成田声名远扬。

en: The new school building is expected to be completed by spring next year.
zh: 新的教学楼预计明年春天竣工。

en: The site for the new factory has not been decided.
zh: 新工厂的选址尚未决定。

en: The new plan was accounted practicable.
zh: 新的计划被认为是可行的。

en: The new model will be on the market in November.
zh: 新款车型将于十一月上市。

en: Joe's idea for a new kind of car will make him filthy rich.
zh: 乔关于新型汽车的想法会让他富得流油。

en: The new model is expected to be put on the market early next year.
zh: 新款车型预计将于明年年初上市。

en: The new model will retail for 30,000 yen.
zh: 新款车型的零售价为3万日元。

en: The new model will be priced at $12,000.
zh: 新款车型的定价为12000美元。

en: A new model isn't necessarily any better than the older one.
zh: 新款车型不一定比旧款更好。

en: This attitude, the Protestant work ethic, still influences Americans today.
zh: 这种态度，即新教伦理，至今仍然影响着美国人。

en: We moved into a new house.
zh: 我们搬进了一栋新房子。

en: Are you quite satisfied with your new house?
zh: 你对你的新房子很满意吗？

en: Please come to see us at our new place.
zh: 请来我们新家看看。

en: Setting a new record added luster to his name.
zh: 创造新纪录为他的名字增添了光彩。

en: Setting a new record added to his fame.
zh: 创造新纪录为他增添了名声。

en: Our project came off with flying colors.
zh: 我们的项目非常成功。

en: The newly-opened jewelry shop took away some of my best customers.
zh: 新开的珠宝店抢走了一些我最好的顾客。

en: The new season's T.V. programs are as much old hat as ever.
zh: 新一季的电视节目和以前一样老套。

en: The new plan worked well.
zh: 新计划进展顺利。

en: If you travel by Shinkansen, it doesn't seem far from Nagoya to Tokyo.
zh: 如果你乘坐新干线，从名古屋到东京似乎并不远。

en: I wish you would make a list of the newly published books.
zh: 我希望你能列一份新出版的书籍清单。

en: They have much snow in Niigata.
zh: 新潟的雪很大。

en: The new school year begins in April in Japan.
zh: 在日本，新学年从四月开始。

en: In Japan, the new school year begins in April.
zh: 在日本，新学年从四月开始。

en: I've been very busy since the new term started.
zh: 自从新学期开始以来，我一直很忙。

en: The new tunnel is twice as long as the old one.
zh: 新隧道是旧隧道的两倍长。

en: Don't complicate the problem by raising new issues.
zh: 不要提出新的问题使问题复杂化。

en: The newcomers cultivated the immense wilderness.
zh: 新来者开垦了广阔的荒野。

en: The heat is on the administration to come up with a new policy.
zh: 政府面临着制定新政策的压力。

en: New facts have been brought to light.
zh: 新的事实已经真相大白。

en: A new argument was presented.
zh: 提出了一个新的论点。

en: New indirect taxes were imposed on spirits.
zh: 对烈酒征收了新的间接税。

en: Another shooting and another friend's gone.
zh: 又一次枪击，又一个朋友离开了。

en: The newcomer sat down at the foot of the table.
zh: 新来的人坐在桌子末端。

en: The new section chief seems to spend most of his time finding fault with the work of his men.
zh: 新任科长似乎把大部分时间都花在挑剔他的部下的工作上。

en: The new line of dresses is from Paris.
zh: 新款连衣裙来自巴黎。

en: The resolution that a new road be built was passed.
zh: 关于修建新道路的决议获得通过。

en: The newly elected president is something of a poet.
zh: 新当选的总统有点像诗人。

en: We have a new puppy. He is about 12 weeks old.
zh: 我们有了一只新小狗。它大约12周大。

en: Newly printed books smell good.
zh: 新印的书闻起来很香。

en: A new topic came up in conversation.
zh: 谈话中出现了一个新话题。

en: The new coalition government is trying to ride out the storm.
zh: 新的联合政府正试图渡过难关。

en: There are plenty of fresh eggs on the table.
zh: 桌子上有许多新鲜的鸡蛋。

en: New blankets were distributed to the poor.
zh: 新的毯子被分发给了穷人。

en: The new fur coats were displayed in the window.
zh: 新的皮草大衣在橱窗里展示。

en: You must turn in your old license in order to get a new one.
zh: 你必须交回旧的执照才能获得新的。

en: I am working on my new book.
zh: 我正在写我的新书。

en: Plans for a new trade zone are still on the drawing board.
zh: 关于建立新的贸易区的计划仍在筹划中。

en: Try a new hat on.
zh: 试试一顶新帽子。

en: The new law should take a bite out of organized crime.
zh: 新法律应该能打击有组织犯罪。

en: The new law will deprive religious minorities of their right to vote.
zh: 新法律将剥夺少数宗教的投票权。

en: The new law has done away with the long-standing custom.
zh: 新法律废除了长期存在的习俗。

en: The new laws sowed the seeds of revolution.
zh: 新法律播下了革命的种子。

en: A new law is expected to cut air pollution by 60%.
zh: 预计一项新法律将减少60%的空气污染。

en: The new law is expected to cut air pollution by 60%.
zh: 预计一项新法律将减少60%的空气污染。

en: A new law has come into existence.
zh: 一项新法律已经生效。

en: Don't be afraid to try new things.
zh: 不要害怕尝试新事物。

en: It wasn't always easy for Edison to invent new things.
zh: 爱迪生发明新事物并不总是容易的。

en: How pretty she looks in her new dress!
zh: 她穿新裙子真漂亮！

en: Where did you have your new suit made?
zh: 你的新西装在哪里做的？

en: A new dress was bought for her.
zh: 给她买了一件新连衣裙。

en: Do not put new wine into old bottles.
zh: 不要把新酒装在旧瓶子里。

en: As a new father, I gave my first child plenty of books.
zh: 作为一个新手父亲，我给了我的第一个孩子很多书。

en: I appeal to you to contribute to the new clinic.
zh: 我呼吁您为新的诊所捐款。

en: I bought a new shaver.
zh: 我买了一个新的剃须刀。

en: The new airplane flies at twice the speed of sound.
zh: 新型飞机以两倍音速飞行。

en: What's the scoop on your new boyfriend?
zh: 你新交的男朋友有什么内幕消息吗？

en: Her new hair-do made her look younger.
zh: 她新做的发型让她看起来更年轻。

en: The new museum is worth visiting.
zh: 新的博物馆值得参观。

en: He retires before the new pension scheme is due to come into effect.
zh: 他在新的养老金计划生效前退休。

en: The new road will benefit the people living in the hills.
zh: 新路将使住在山区的人们受益。

en: New roads were constructed one after another.
zh: 一条又一条的新路被修建起来。

en: A new road is under construction.
zh: 一条新路正在建设中。

en: It always takes time to get used to a new place.
zh: 适应一个新的地方总是需要时间的。

en: The new railway is not completed yet.
zh: 新的铁路尚未完工。

en: A new study suggests that hospital records for patients older than 65 are often incorrect, which may lead to serious treatment errors.
zh: 一项新的研究表明，65岁以上患者的医院记录通常不正确，这可能导致严重的治疗错误。

en: The new subway enables me to get to school in 20 minutes.
zh: 新的地铁使我能在20分钟内到达学校。

en: He didn't want to disappoint his wife by giving up his new position.
zh: 他不愿放弃新的职位，让妻子失望。

en: I am sure you will take an active role in your new position.
zh: 我相信你会在新的职位上发挥积极作用。

en: The new President is well spoken of.
zh: 新总统备受好评。

en: What do you think of the new teacher?
zh: 你觉得新老师怎么样？

en: New stamps will be issued next month.
zh: 下个月将发行新的邮票。

en: The new tax law is full of loopholes.
zh: 新的税法漏洞百出。

en: The new tax system comes into effect next year.
zh: 新的税收制度将于明年生效。

en: A new tax was imposed on wine.
zh: 对葡萄酒征收了一项新税。

en: The introduction of the new tax is expected to affect the entire economy.
zh: 预计新税的实施将影响整个经济。

en: The new production process achieves a high yield.
zh: 新的生产工艺实现了高产量。

en: The new government promised to rid the country of corruption.
zh: 新政府承诺消除该国的腐败。

en: This was how matters stood at the turn of the century.
zh: 世纪之交，情况就是这样。

en: The rock has been blasted to make a new course for the stream.
zh: 为了给这条小溪开辟一条新路，岩石已经被炸开了。

en: I have a new relative: my sister got married, so now I have a brother-in-law.
zh: 我多了一个新亲戚：我妹妹结婚了，所以我现在有了一个妹夫。

en: How fast the new Shinkansen goes!
zh: 新干线真快啊！

en: New truth and knowledge always elevate human life and most usually find practical application.
zh: 新的真理和知识总是能提升人类的生活，而且通常都能找到实际应用。

en: How's your new job?
zh: 你的新工作怎么样？

en: I started a new job, and it's been a struggle just to keep my head above the water.
zh: 我开始了一份新工作，我一直在努力挣扎，才勉强能维持生计。

en: It is easy to make friends even in the new places.
zh: 即使在新的地方也很容易交到朋友。

en: He's wearing a new coat.
zh: 他穿着一件新外套。

en: I was given a new jacket.
zh: 我得到了一件新夹克。

en: What is the address of the new bookshop?
zh: 新书店的地址是什么？

en: The new birth policy is aimed at achieving zero population growth.
zh: 新的生育政策旨在实现零人口增长。

en: Please let me know your new address.
zh: 请告诉我你的新地址。

en: I had trouble with the new car. It was difficult to steer.
zh: 我的新车出了问题，很难操控。

en: My new car will arrive here next week.
zh: 我的新车下周会到。

en: The new company rule was unfair to older workers.
zh: 新的公司规定对老员工不公平。

en: A new car came to a standstill in front of the bank.
zh: 一辆新车在银行门前停了下来。

en: I want to buy a new bicycle.
zh: 我想买一辆新自行车。

en: The new bicycle cost me as much as 50,000 yen.
zh: 这辆新自行车花了我5万日元。

en: I've got a new bike.
zh: 我有一辆新自行车。

en: If you want a new bike, you'd better start saving up.
zh: 如果你想要一辆新自行车，你最好开始攒钱。

en: I need a new bicycle.
zh: 我需要一辆新自行车。

en: We ought to buy some new office equipment: the stuff we've got is out of date.
zh: 我们应该买一些新的办公设备：我们现在用的东西已经过时了。

en: Please visit us in our new office.
zh: 请来我们新办公室参观。

en: The new venture was financed by a group of entrepreneurs.
zh: 这项新的风险投资是由一群企业家资助的。

en: We are looking forward to your visit to our new office.
zh: 我们期待您来参观我们的新办公室。

en: Take great care when you put your hand to a new business.
zh: 当你开始一项新业务时，务必小心谨慎。

en: Please send us more information.
zh: 请给我们发送更多信息。

en: A new branch will be opened in Chicago next month.
zh: 下个月将在芝加哥开设一家新分店。

en: What is the new leader like?
zh: 新领导怎么样？

en: Plans are under way to build a new city hospital.
zh: 正在计划建造一家新的城市医院。

en: When looking for a new job, do not forget to read the want ads in the newspaper.
zh: 在寻找新工作时，不要忘记阅读报纸上的招聘广告。

en: His new job brought him a handsome income.
zh: 他的新工作给他带来了一笔可观的收入。

en: How are you getting along in your new job?
zh: 你的新工作进展如何？

en: How do you like your new job?
zh: 你喜欢你的新工作吗？

en: How are you getting along with your new job?
zh: 你的新工作进展如何？

en: Can you adapt yourself to the new job?
zh: 你能适应新的工作吗？

en: He was tense with his new business.
zh: 他因新业务而感到紧张。

en: Every success in your new job.
zh: 祝你在新工作中一切顺利。

en: Good luck with the new job.
zh: 祝你新工作顺利。

en: I'm sure you like your new job.
zh: 我相信你喜欢你的新工作。

en: He promised to bring new industries to the region, but politicians rarely keep their word.
zh: 他承诺为该地区带来新的产业，但政客很少信守诺言。

en: The new industry brought about changes in our life.
zh: 新的产业给我们的生活带来了变化。

en: The new industry transformed the town into a big city.
zh: 新的产业把这个镇变成了一个大城市。

en: I left a new umbrella in the bus.
zh: 我把一把新伞落在公共汽车上了。

en: When will the new magazine come out?
zh: 新的杂志什么时候出版？

en: A new difficulty has arisen.
zh: 出现了一个新的困难。

en: We enjoyed driving along the new expressway.
zh: 我们很喜欢沿着新的高速公路行驶。

en: A new idea came to me.
zh: 我突然有了一个新的想法。

en: A new principal is administering the school.
zh: 一位新的校长正在管理这所学校。

en: The new school building is the boast of the village.
zh: 新教学楼是这个村子的骄傲。

en: A new school building is under construction.
zh: 一栋新的教学楼正在建设中。

en: There was a new candidate on the ticket at the Democratic convention.
zh: 在民主党大会上，出现了一位新的候选人。

en: Look up the new words in your dictionary.
zh: 查一下字典里的生词。

en: The framework of the new building is progressively appearing.
zh: 新建筑的框架正在逐渐显现。

en: A new moon was coming up.
zh: 一弯新月即将升起。

en: The new moon came out.
zh: 新月出来了。

en: I must acquaint myself with the details of the new plan.
zh: 我必须了解新计划的细节。

en: Preparations for the new project are under way in both companies simultaneously.
zh: 两家公司同时为新项目做准备。

en: The new contract enables us to demand whatever we want.
zh: 新合同使我们能够提出任何我们想要的要求。

en: Because the new trainee did things sluggishly, he was told that he'd be fired if he didn't start taking his job seriously.
zh: 因为新学员做事拖拖拉拉，他被告知如果他不开始认真对待他的工作，他就会被解雇。

en: I'm breaking in my new shoes.
zh: 我正在穿新鞋，让它们更合脚。

en: The new bridge was named Rainbow Bridge.
zh: 新桥被命名为彩虹桥。

en: The new bridge will have been completed by March.
zh: 新桥将于三月份完工。

en: The new bridge will be as long as 1.5 km.
zh: 新桥将长达1.5公里。

en: The new bridge is in process of construction.
zh: 新桥正在建设中。

en: The new bridge made it easy for the villagers to go to town.
zh: 新桥使村民们更容易去镇上。

en: A new bridge is being built over the river.
zh: 一座新桥正在河上建造。

en: The leader of the new republic is buckling under political pressures.
zh: 新共和国的领导人在政治压力下步履维艰。

en: New guests must register in the hotel book.
zh: 新来的客人必须在酒店登记簿上登记。

en: The new regulations were confirmed by the full committee.
zh: 新规定已获得全体委员会的确认。

en: The new equipment enabled us to finish the work in an hour.
zh: 新设备使我们能够在一小时内完成工作。

en: The company asked the bank to loan them some money to buy new machinery.
zh: 公司要求银行贷款给他们一些钱来购买新机器。

en: The new machine brought in a lot of money.
zh: 新机器带来了很多钱。

en: Did you request a new desk?
zh: 你申请了一张新桌子吗？

en: He felt ill at ease in the new surroundings.
zh: 在新环境中，他感到很不自在。

en: We had to gear our lives to the new circumstances.
zh: 我们不得不使自己的生活适应新的环境。

en: I found it pretty hard to adjust to my new surroundings.
zh: 我发现很难适应新的环境。

en: The new school is of simple and modern construction.
zh: 这所新学校的建筑风格简洁而现代。

en: How do you like your new school?
zh: 你觉得你的新学校怎么样？

en: There was a controversy about the location of the new school.
zh: 关于新学校的选址存在争议。

en: You must quickly accustom yourself to your new school.
zh: 你必须尽快适应你的新学校。

en: I hear you'll set up a new company.
zh: 我听说你要成立一家新公司。

en: The flowers in her new vase refreshed her.
zh: 她新花瓶里的花使她精神焕发。

en: Money is the key factor when we decide to buy a new house.
zh: 当我们决定买新房时，钱是关键因素。

en: The new house didn't live up to expectations.
zh: 新房子没有达到预期。

en: Now that we're in our new house, I have to inform the post office of the change of address.
zh: 既然我们已经搬进了新家，我必须通知邮局更改地址。

en: The new station building is under construction and will be completed soon.
zh: 新的车站大楼正在建设中，很快就会完工。

en: The new train station is under construction and will be completed soon.
zh: 新的火车站正在建设中，很快就会完工。

en: How many new sites were uncovered?
zh: 有多少新的遗址被发现？

en: Will you show me your new word processor today?
zh: 今天你能给我看看你的新文字处理器吗？

en: I was anxious for a new word processor.
zh: 我渴望有一个新的文字处理器。

en: The food at the new restaurant is nothing special - average at best.
zh: 这家新餐厅的食物没什么特别的，充其量只能算一般。

en: It is said that a new restaurant was constructed.
zh: 据说一家新餐厅建成了。

en: We played the game in accordance with the new rules.
zh: 我们按照新规则玩游戏。

en: I'll buy a new one.
zh: 我再买一个新的。

en: A novelty wears off in time.
zh: 新奇感会随着时间的推移而消失。

en: The new model is featured by higher power and speed.
zh: 新型号的特点是更高的功率和速度。

en: The new hall is double the size of the old one.
zh: 新大厅是旧大厅的两倍大。

en: I need a new pen. I'll buy one.
zh: 我需要一支新笔。我买一支。

en: I have a new pen; I'll lend it to you.
zh: 我有一支新钢笔，可以借给你。

en: Five years have been spent building the new building.
zh: 这座新建筑花了五年时间建造。

en: We are excited about the move to the new building.
zh: 我们对搬进新大楼感到很兴奋。

en: The new building cut the view from my window.
zh: 新大楼挡住了我窗外的景色。

en: I am looking for a part-time job so I can buy a new video camera.
zh: 我正在找一份兼职工作，这样我就可以买一台新的摄像机。

en: I am saving money in order to buy a new personal computer.
zh: 我正在存钱，为了买一台新的个人电脑。

en: I can't afford to buy a new bike, so I'll have to manage with this old one.
zh: 我买不起一辆新自行车，所以我只能凑合用这辆旧的了。

en: She looked very beautiful in her new dress.
zh: 她穿着新裙子看起来非常漂亮。

en: She was satisfied with the new dress.
zh: 她对这条新裙子很满意。

en: Please help me pick out a sweater which matches my new dress.
zh: 请帮我挑选一件和我的新裙子相配的毛衣。

en: She's pleased with her new dress.
zh: 她对她的新裙子很满意。

en: The new department store will be opened next month.
zh: 新的百货公司将于下个月开业。

en: I'm going to ask for a new desk.
zh: 我打算要一张新桌子。

en: The new team has the capability to win.
zh: 新团队有获胜的能力。

en: The new sofa goes with the curtains.
zh: 新沙发和窗帘很搭配。

en: The project to build a new sports center has fallen through for lack of adequate funds.
zh: 由于缺乏足够的资金，建造新体育中心的计划已经落空。

en: I have to buy a new pair of skis.
zh: 我得买一副新的滑雪板。

en: I must get a new suit made.
zh: 我必须做一套新西装。

en: I had a new suit made.
zh: 我做了一套新西装。

en: A new shopping mall opened on the edge of town.
zh: 一个新的购物中心在城郊开业了。

en: We want a new carpet.
zh: 我们想要一块新地毯。

en: I spilled some fruit juice on my new shirt.
zh: 我不小心把一些果汁洒在了我的新衬衫上。

en: The new jet circles the globe in twenty-four hours.
zh: 新型喷气式飞机在二十四小时内环绕地球一周。

en: The new computer was too complicated for me to use at first.
zh: 这台新电脑一开始对我来说太复杂了，我不会用。

en: The new computer is ten times as fast as the old one.
zh: 这台新电脑比旧电脑快十倍。

en: Mary was silly to buy a new coat.
zh: 玛丽买新外套真是太傻了。

en: Do you get along well with your new classmates?
zh: 你和新同学相处得好吗？

en: How are you getting along with your new classmates?
zh: 你和新同学相处得怎么样？

en: How do you like your new class?
zh: 你喜欢你的新班级吗？

en: You have to have a new crown.
zh: 你得做一个新牙冠。

en: Send me a new catalog.
zh: 给我寄一份新目录。

en: This is a limited time offer to new customers only.
zh: 这是仅限新客户的限时优惠。

en: New office buildings seem to be sprouting up all over the city.
zh: 新的办公大楼似乎在城市各处涌现。

en: A new oil tanker was launched.
zh: 一艘新的油轮下水了。

en: The new engine must undergo all the necessary tests.
zh: 新引擎必须经过所有必要的测试。

en: We need to develop a new kind of energy.
zh: 我们需要开发一种新的能源。

en: It will cost me a lot to furnish my new apartment.
zh: 布置我的新公寓要花我很多钱。

en: I spent 3,000 yen on a new CD.
zh: 我花3000日元买了一张新CD。

en: The marketing department is responsible for pricing new service.
zh: 市场部负责新服务的定价。

en: In looking back, I feel deeply grateful to my parents.
zh: 回首往事，我深深感谢我的父母。

en: The cat in gloves catches no mice.
zh: 戴手套的猫捉不到老鼠。（比喻：不肯付出努力的人是不会有收获的）

en: I will be back to square one and have to take the classes over.
zh: 我将回到原点，不得不重修这些课程。

en: We were back to square one.
zh: 我们又回到了原点。

en: Don't look back cause you know what you might see.
zh: 别回头，因为你知道你可能会看到什么。（比喻：不要沉溺于过去）

en: Shinya married a pretty girl.
zh: 信也娶了一个漂亮的女孩。

en: It is important to drive carefully.
zh: 小心驾驶很重要。

en: It is clear that he failed for lack of prudence.
zh: 很明显，他因为缺乏谨慎而失败了。

en: Some psychologists raise doubts about Pepperberg's research.
zh: 一些心理学家对佩珀伯格的研究提出了质疑。

en: Dr. Patterson, a psychologist, has tested Koko's IQ.
zh: 心理学家帕特森博士测试了科科的智商。

en: Psychology deals with human emotions.
zh: 心理学研究人类的情感。

en: Psychology is the scientific study of the mind.
zh: 心理学是对心灵的科学研究。

en: Psychology is the science of the mind.
zh: 心理学是研究心灵的科学。

en: In the matter of psychology, he is an expert.
zh: 在心理学方面，他是个专家。

en: Nobody is free from care.
zh: 没有人能摆脱忧虑。

en: Recently what with anxiety and lack of sleep, she has lost almost ten pounds.
zh: 最近她因为焦虑和睡眠不足，瘦了将近十斤。

en: Worrying deprived him of sleep.
zh: 忧虑剥夺了他的睡眠。

en: Worries aged him rapidly.
zh: 忧虑使他迅速衰老。

en: Anxiety lined his face.
zh: 焦虑使他的脸上布满皱纹。

en: Worry turned his hair white.
zh: 忧虑使他的头发变白了。

en: Worrying deprived me of sleep last night.
zh: 昨晚的忧虑使我失眠了。

en: I've been worrying myself into depression.
zh: 我一直忧心忡忡，都快抑郁了。

en: There's nothing to worry about.
zh: 没什么好担心的。

en: There is no cause for undue alarm.
zh: 没有必要过分惊慌。

en: There is no cause for worry.
zh: 没什么好担心的。

en: Don't worry, I'll help you. Just take it easy.
zh: 别担心，我会帮你的。放轻松点。

en: Take it easy. Things are looking up.
zh: 放轻松。情况正在好转。

en: Don't worry. You'll make it.
zh: 别担心，你能行的。

en: Don't worry. It's a common mistake.
zh: 别担心，这是个常见的错误。

en: Don't worry. It's OK.
zh: 别担心，没事的。

en: Don't worry. I have completely recovered.
zh: 别担心，我已经完全康复了。

en: Don't worry. You can count on me.
zh: 别担心，你可以信任我。

en: Don't worry. I'm not mad at you.
zh: 别担心，我没有生你的气。

en: Don't worry. I'll take care of you.
zh: 别担心，我会照顾你的。

en: What is the use of worrying?
zh: 担心有什么用呢？

en: What's the use of worrying?
zh: 担心有什么用呢？

en: I'm so lucky to have someone who cares.
zh: 我很幸运能有这么关心我的人。

en: Few people are free from cares.
zh: 很少有人能摆脱烦恼。

en: There's no need to worry.
zh: 没必要担心。

en: I'll take your ECG.
zh: 我来给你做个心电图。

en: You have my sympathies.
zh: 我对你表示同情。

en: I had a heart attack.
zh: 我心脏病发作了。

en: The number of people suffering from heart disease has increased.
zh: 患心脏病的人数增加了。

en: After his heart attack, Jim had to cut down on his sugar intake.
zh: 吉姆心脏病发作后，不得不减少糖的摄入量。

en: The heart is made of muscle.
zh: 心脏是由肌肉组成的。

en: The heart works slowly.
zh: 心脏工作缓慢。

en: The function of the heart is to pump blood.
zh: 心脏的功能是泵血。

en: We learn about the structure of the heart in junior high school.
zh: 我们在初中学到心脏的结构。

en: My heart quickened.
zh: 我的心跳加速了。

en: My heart is beating fast.
zh: 我的心脏跳得很快。

en: It's not good for my heart.
zh: 这对我的心脏不好。

en: The human heart is analogous to a pump.
zh: 人的心脏类似于一个泵。

en: I felt my heart beating rapidly.
zh: 我感觉我的心脏跳动很快。

en: My heart fluttered with excitement.
zh: 我的心激动得怦怦直跳。

en: It's abnormal to have the heart on the right side.
zh: 心脏长在右边是不正常的。

en: My heart's beating so fast!
zh: 我的心脏跳得太快了！

en: My heart is pounding so hard it feels like it's going to explode.
zh: 我的心脏跳得太厉害了，感觉要爆炸了。

en: Lately I've had the time to quietly enjoy the wonders of nature.
zh: 最近我有时间静静地欣赏大自然的奇观。

en: You'll have to turn over a new leaf.
zh: 你必须改过自新。

en: I'll turn over a new leaf and study English very hard.
zh: 我会改过自新，努力学习英语。

en: A good conscience is a soft pillow.
zh: 问心无愧，高枕无忧。

en: Piano music soothes the soul.
zh: 钢琴音乐能抚慰心灵。

en: You must turn over a new leaf and work as hard as possible.
zh: 你必须改过自新，尽可能努力工作。

en: I can't look at this photo without feeling very sad.
zh: 我一看这张照片就感到非常难过。

en: I closed my eyes to calm down.
zh: 我闭上眼睛让自己冷静下来。

en: Pray with all your heart.
zh: 全心全意地祈祷。

en: I thank you from the bottom of my heart.

en: Water the plants.

en: Plants grow.

en: The lock is broken.

en: Steam trains were replaced by electric trains.

en: A staff is used to help steady yourself when walking, much like a cane.

en: I fix the terms.

en: Do you know where to go or whom to ask for information?

en: Do you know where to go or who to ask for information?

en: The information is leaking piecemeal to the press.
zh: 信息正在一点一点地泄露给媒体。

en: A polite way to reveal knowledge of a fact without telling the source of the information is to say, "a little bird told me".
zh: 一种礼貌地透露对某个事实的了解而不透露信息来源的方式是说，“小鸟告诉我的”。

en: Information is sometimes held back from patients when it is thought it might upset them.
zh: 有时，当认为信息可能会让患者不安时，会向他们隐瞒信息。

en: The information seems to have leaked out.
zh: 信息似乎已经泄露了。

en: Bad news is preferable to an absence of information.
zh: 坏消息胜过没有信息。

en: The situation is getting worse and worse day by day.
zh: 情况一天比一天糟糕。

en: The situation is hopeless.
zh: 情况毫无希望。

en: The situation got out of the government's control.
zh: 局势失去了政府的控制。

en: The situation calls for drastic measures.
zh: 情况需要采取严厉措施。

en: The situation has taken on a new aspect.
zh: 情况呈现出新的面貌。

en: The odds are against us.
zh: 我们胜算不大。

en: The situation calls for our action.
zh: 情况需要我们采取行动。

en: The situation went from bad to worse.
zh: 情况每况愈下。

en: Everything is against us.
zh: 一切都对我们不利。

en: One good turn deserves another.
zh: 善有善报。

en: I was moved to tears in spite of myself.
zh: 我情不自禁地感动得流下了眼泪。

en: He who gives to another bestows on himself.
zh: 施予他人者，实乃自予。

en: Knowledge without common sense counts for nothing.
zh: 没有常识的知识毫无价值。

en: Knowledge without common sense counts for little.
zh: 没有常识的知识没什么用。

en: I think that knowledge without common sense counts for nothing.
zh: 我认为没有常识的知识毫无价值。

en: Though commonsense is necessary for everyone, it is not always easily acquired.
zh: 虽然常识对每个人来说都是必要的，但它并不总是容易获得。

en: Nobody that has any common sense would think of doing such nonsense.
zh: 任何有常识的人都不会想到做这种蠢事。

en: A man of common sense would never do such a thing.
zh: 一个有常识的人绝不会做这种事。

en: A person with common sense would never do this kind of thing.
zh: 一个有常识的人绝不会做这种事。

en: Who that has common sense can believe it?
zh: 谁有常识会相信它呢？

en: Who, that has common sense, would do such a thing?
zh: 谁，有常识，会做这种事呢？

en: A man of sense would be ashamed of such behavior.
zh: 一个有理性的人会为这种行为感到羞耻。

en: Who that has common sense can believe such a thing?
zh: 谁有常识会相信这种事呢？

en: To be always logical may be sometimes hated by others.
zh: 总是合乎逻辑有时可能会被别人讨厌。

en: I always have a tired feeling.
zh: 我总是感到疲倦。

en: To be always ready for war, said Mentor, is the surest way to avoid it.
zh: 导师说，时刻准备战争是避免战争最可靠的方法。

en: Always do what is right.
zh: 永远做正确的事。

en: You must always do what is right.
zh: 你必须永远做正确的事。

en: It is the border-line cases that are always in danger: the dignified buildings of the past which may possess no real artistic or historic value, but which people have become sentimentally attached to and have grown to love.
zh: 总是那些模棱两可的情况最危险：过去那些可能没有真正的艺术或历史价值，但人们已经产生了情感依恋并开始喜爱的庄严建筑。

en: You should always think before you speak.
zh: 你应该三思而后行。

en: I always feel hungry.
zh: 我总是感到饥饿。

en: You should always do your best.
zh: 你应该总是尽你所能。

en: Always obey your father.
zh: 永远服从你的父亲。

en: Could you please make room for me?
zh: 请你给我让个地方好吗？

en: Please tell me your location.
zh: 请告诉我你的位置。

en: The scene was a tiny mountain village in a remote section of West Virginia.
zh: 场景是西弗吉尼亚州偏远地区的一个小山村。

en: Where did it happen?
zh: 它在哪里发生的？

en: Just appoint the time and place and I'll be there.
zh: 你定个时间和地点，我准到。

en: I think it depends.
zh: 我觉得这要看情况。

en: The party grew chilly.
zh: 聚会的气氛变得冷淡起来。

en: All was silent throughout the castle.
zh: 整个城堡一片寂静。

en: The castle stands facing a beautiful lake.
zh: 城堡面对着美丽的湖泊。

en: The castle lies to the east of the town.
zh: 城堡位于城镇的东边。

en: The castle is across the river.
zh: 城堡在河的对岸。

en: The site of the castle is now a park.
zh: 城堡的遗址现在是一个公园。

en: You have to be joking.
zh: 你一定是在开玩笑吧。

en: Can there be a computer intelligent enough to tell a joke?
zh: 会有足够聪明的电脑来判断一个笑话吗？

en: I don't feel like joking.
zh: 我没心情开玩笑。

en: Whether we find a joke funny or not largely depends on where we have been brought up.
zh: 我们觉得一个笑话是否好笑，很大程度上取决于我们成长的环境。

en: You must be joking!
zh: 你一定是在开玩笑吧！

en: You have got to be kidding me.
zh: 你一定是在开玩笑吧。

en: You have to be joking!
zh: 你一定是在开玩笑吧！

en: You've got to be kidding me!
zh: 你一定是在开玩笑吧！

en: You must be joking.
zh: 你一定是在开玩笑吧。

en: You've got to be kidding me.
zh: 你一定是在开玩笑吧！

en: You mustn't carry your jokes too far!
zh: 你的玩笑可别开过头了！

en: Don't pull my leg!
zh: 别开玩笑了！

en: Apart from joking, what do you mean to do?
zh: 除了开玩笑，你到底想做什么？

en: Get serious.
zh: 认真点。

en: Stop joking around.
zh: 别再开玩笑了。

en: Stop joking.
zh: 别开玩笑了。

en: No more of your jokes, please.
zh: 请不要再开玩笑了。

en: Joking apart, you ought to see a doctor about your headache.
zh: 不开玩笑地说，你应该去看医生，看看你的头痛。

en: Joking aside, what do you mean to do?
zh: 不开玩笑地说，你打算怎么做？

en: Joking aside, what are you trying to say?
zh: 不开玩笑地说，你想说什么？

en: Joking aside, how are things going?
zh: 不开玩笑地说，情况怎么样？

en: I said so by way of a joke.
zh: 我那是开玩笑说的。

en: There's many a true word spoken in jest.
zh: 戏言成真。

en: He said so in jest.
zh: 他是开玩笑说的。

en: Never tell a lie, either for fun or from fear.
zh: 永远不要说谎，无论是为了好玩还是因为害怕。

en: Don't think I'm joking.
zh: 别以为我在开玩笑。

en: You can't be serious! He's no more a doctor than I am.
zh: 你不是认真的吧！他根本不是医生，我也不是。

en: It's no joke.
zh: 这可不是闹着玩的。

en: You are carrying your joke a bit too far.
zh: 你这个玩笑开得有点过分了。

en: My joke went over very well.
zh: 我的玩笑很受欢迎。

en: The entire crew was afflicted with food poisoning.
zh: 全体船员都得了食物中毒。

en: There were 120 people on the plane, exclusive of the crew.
zh: 飞机上有120人，不包括机组人员。

en: All the crew were tired.
zh: 所有船员都很累。

en: The crew were all waiting for the news.
zh: 全体船员都在等待消息。

en: The crew is now opening the hatch.
zh: 机组人员正在打开舱门。

en: I'd like to try horseback riding.
zh: 我想试试骑马。

en: The crew prepared for the voyage to outer space.
zh: 机组人员为前往外太空的航行做准备。

en: The crew had to abandon the sinking ship.
zh: 船员不得不弃船。

en: The whole crew was saved.
zh: 全体船员都获救了。

en: All the crew were saved.
zh: 所有船员都获救了。

en: The crew abandoned the ship.
zh: 船员弃船了。

en: Some of the crew were drowned.
zh: 一些船员溺水身亡。
